title: Revamp Valentine UI to kawaii viral multi-screen gift experience

requirements.text: Revamp Screen 1 (main page) UI to a Pinterest/TikTok-style kawaii Valentine aesthetic: soft pastel pink gradient background, small heart doodles/cute decorations, rounded corners, smooth soft shadows, and clean minimal typography; ensure the layout is fully responsive for mobile.

quotes: Create a viral cute Valentine’s Day interactive website (Pinterest / TikTok style) with a soft pastel pink + red aesthetic, kawaii doodles, floating hearts, rounded corners, smooth shadows, and clean minimal typography. Make it fully responsive for mobile.

acceptanceCriteria: On mobile and desktop widths, Screen 1 content stays centered and readable without overflow or clipped UI.
Background uses a pastel pink gradient and includes visible heart doodles/cute decorations.
UI uses consistently rounded corners and soft shadows across interactive elements (buttons/cards).
Typography is minimal/clean and consistent across both screens and gift views.

requirements.text: Update Screen 1 content and decorations: add a small “14 FEB” calendar icon in a top corner; add cute bunny/heart sticker-style visuals near the heading; set centered copy to exactly “Hey there,\nWill you be my Valentine?” (line break between greeting and question).

quotes: Add a small “14 FEB” calendar icon in the top corner
Add cute bunny/heart stickers near the heading

Center text:
“Hey there,
Will you be my Valentine?”

acceptanceCriteria: A “14 FEB” calendar icon is visible in a top corner on Screen 1 and remains well-positioned on mobile.
At least two sticker-style visuals (bunny/heart) appear near the heading and do not overlap the main text on mobile.
Main centered text matches exactly: first line “Hey there,” and second line “Will you be my Valentine?”.

requirements.text: Update Screen 1 buttons to exactly two prominent rounded buttons labeled “YES OF COURSE” and “NO THANK YOU”; make the YES button slightly larger/more inviting than the NO button while keeping both easily tappable on mobile.

quotes:
Two rounded buttons:
	•	YES OF COURSE
	•	NO THANK YOU
	•	Make the YES button slightly bigger and more inviting

acceptanceCriteria: Screen 1 shows exactly two primary options with labels “YES OF COURSE” and “NO THANK YOU”.
YES button is visually larger than NO button (e.g., size, emphasis) and looks more inviting.
Both buttons have large touch targets suitable for mobile (no tiny tap areas).

requirements.text: Preserve and adapt the evasive interaction for the “NO THANK YOU” button so it moves away on hover (pointer devices) and on tap/press attempt (touch devices), keeping it effectively unclickable while staying within visible bounds of its container on common mobile viewports.

quotes: Make the “NO THANK YOU” button move away when hovered / tapped (funny viral style)

acceptanceCriteria: On desktop hover/pointer enter, the “NO THANK YOU” button relocates before it can be clicked.
On touch devices, attempting to tap/press “NO THANK YOU” causes it to move away before a click completes.
The button does not move off-screen or become permanently unreachable due to positioning; it remains visible within the interaction area.

requirements.text: Replace the current post-YES “Good choice” meme view with Screen 2: show big text exactly “Yay, you said yes!\nI made all these for you hehe”; display a cute animated heart character on the left; show three large rounded gift cards/boxes labeled “Gift 1”, “Gift 2”, “Gift 3”; include smooth transitions and soft pop animations when Screen 2 appears and when hovering/tapping gift cards.

quotes:
SCREEN 2 (After Clicking YES)
	•	Show big cute text:
“Yay, you said yes!
I made all these for you hehe”
	•	Add a cute animated heart character on the left
	•	Show 3 big rounded gift cards/boxes:
	•	Gift 1
	•	Gift 2
	•	Gift 3
	•	Smooth transitions + soft pop animations

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking “YES OF COURSE” navigates to/updates the UI to Screen 2 (no meme-only success screen).
Screen 2 headline text matches exactly with the specified line break.
An animated heart character is visible on the left side on desktop and reflows appropriately on mobile (e.g., above or alongside content without overlap).
Three prominent gift cards labeled “Gift 1”, “Gift 2”, “Gift 3” are visible and tappable, with rounded corners and soft shadows.
Screen 2 entry and gift-card interactions include noticeable smooth transitions/pop animations.

requirements.text: Implement Gift 1 as a dedicated screen or modal/popup opened from Screen 2: show a centered bouquet of red roses with a ribbon; place cute message bubbles around it containing exactly these lines: “I will always love you no matter what”, “You are the best part of my life”, “You will forever be my only option”, “I can’t imagine my life without you”; add floating hearts animation on this view.

quotes:
Gift 1:
	•	A bouquet of red roses in the center with a ribbon
	•	Around it, cute message bubbles that say:
	•	“I will always love you no matter what”
	•	“You are the best part of my life”
	•	“You will forever be my only option”
	•	“I can’t imagine my life without you”
	•	Add floating hearts animation

acceptanceCriteria: Opening “Gift 1” shows a bouquet of red roses with a ribbon as the central visual.
All four message bubbles are present and match the provided text exactly (including punctuation).
Message bubbles are positioned around the bouquet and remain readable on mobile (stack/reflow allowed).
Floating hearts animation is visible while Gift 1 view is open.

requirements.text: Implement Gift 2 as a dedicated screen or modal/popup opened from Screen 2: show a short romantic love letter inside a cute card UI (sweet, simple, emotional, not cringe); add sparkles and small hearts as decorative animation elements.

quotes:
Gift 2:
	•	A short romantic love letter in a cute card UI
	•	Example vibe: sweet, simple, emotional, not cringe
	•	Add sparkles and small hearts

acceptanceCriteria: Opening “Gift 2” shows a card-style UI containing a short love letter.
Love letter tone matches: sweet/simple/emotional (avoid overly exaggerated or crude phrasing).
Sparkles and small hearts decorations/animations are visible on the Gift 2 view without obstructing the text on mobile.

requirements.text: Implement Gift 3 as a dedicated screen or modal/popup opened from Screen 2: show a final screen with big cute messages including exactly “Happy Valentine’s Day ❤️” and “You’re my favorite person”; add a heart burst animation and confetti hearts animation.

quotes:
Gift 3:
	•	A final screen with a big cute message like:
“Happy Valentine’s Day ❤️”
“You’re my favorite person”	•	Add heart burst animation + confetti hearts

acceptanceCriteria: Opening “Gift 3” displays both lines exactly: “Happy Valentine’s Day ❤️” and “You’re my favorite person”.
A heart burst animation plays when Gift 3 opens.
Confetti hearts animation is visible on Gift 3 view.

requirements.text: Provide navigation affordances for gift views (screen or modal/popup) so the user can return to Screen 2 after viewing a gift, with transitions consistent with the app’s soft pop/smooth animation style.

quotes: GIFTS (Each Gift Opens a New Screen or Popup)

acceptanceCriteria: Each gift view includes a clear way to close/go back to Screen 2.
Returning to Screen 2 preserves the same general styling and does not require a full page reload.
Open/close transitions feel smooth and consistent with the rest of the experience.

requirements.text: Integrate all newly required decorative/character/illustration assets as static files under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them from the frontend (no backend image fetching).

quotes: kawaii doodles, floating hearts, ... cute animated heart character ... bouquet of red roses ... calendar icon ... stickers

acceptanceCriteria: All newly generated images referenced by the UI are present under frontend/public/assets/generated.
The frontend references these assets via static paths (e.g., /assets/generated/...).
No backend endpoints are introduced for serving or transforming images.

constraints: Frontend must remain a React + TypeScript app using the existing Tailwind/Shadcn setup (do not switch to a standalone HTML/CSS/JS build).
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose existing components instead).
Do not modify immutable hook/entry files listed in the system context (e.g., frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts).
Backend remains single-actor (backend/main.mo); do not add extra backend services.
Keep the existing evasive “No” behavior pattern (hover/pointer + touch) while updating styling/labels.
nonGoals: Adding user accounts/authentication flows beyond what already exists in the template.
Persisting gifts/choices to the backend or adding any database-like storage.
Integrations with external social, messaging, or analytics services.

required: Small kawaii calendar icon with “14 FEB” text (calendar-14-feb-kawaii.dim_256x256.png)
Seamless pastel heart doodle pattern tile (heart-doodle-pattern-tile.dim_512x512.png)
Cute heart character (idle pose) with simple animation-ready design on transparent background (heart-character.dim_512x512.png)
Bouquet of red roses with ribbon, centered composition on transparent background (rose-bouquet-ribbon.dim_1024x1024.png)
Confetti hearts assortment (small heart shapes) on transparent background (confetti-hearts.dim_1024x1024.png)
